title: tsunomaki_watame_(watame_night_fever!!)
body:
The 6th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Tsunomaki Watame]].

In this costume, she wears a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white dress]] with a [[white belt]] an [[o-ring thigh strap|white o-ring]] [[thigh strap]] [[black thighhighs]] and [[black boots|black]] [[boots]]. This costume also comes in with either a [[white shirt]] or a [[black shirt]] with [[clothes writing|words on it]] saying "Watame Night Fever!!", the name of her reoccurring karaoke streams and of her 1st solo 3D concert. Her breast size is also noticeably [[large breasts|larger]] in this costume, rivaling even that of [[Shirogane Noel]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has her [[long hair]] tied into a [[ponytail]] with partial bangs, with the left hand side of her bangs decorated with three hair clips.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #20982084: Profile (2D)
* !asset #24457501: Profile (3D)
* !post #6848241: Merchandise

title: bon_homme_richard_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the Essex-class aircraft carrier USS [i]Bon Homme Richard[/i] in [[Azur Lane]], currently a story-only character.

She was historically named after:
* John Paul Jones' eponymous frigate from the American Revolutionary War
* [[Benjamin Franklin]] (albeit rendered as "Bonhomme Richard")

h4. Appearance
Unlike the other [i]Essex[/i]-class carriers already implemented, [i]Bon Homme Richard[/i] is depicted in a younger physical form, and it is implied to be the form that she will appear in her normal Eagle Union Faction form. She sports [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]] with a [[belt]] [[hairband]] that is reminiscent of [[Shirogane Noel]]. She has [[blue eyes]] in her Eagle Union form.

h4. Related Characters
h5. Essex-class Aircraft Carriers

title: charge_blade
body:
Known as "charge axe" in Japan. A type of weapon introduced to the [[monster hunter (series)|Monster Hunter]] series as of [[monster_hunter_4|Monster Hunter 4]]. The weapon comes in two parts - a [[sword]] and a [[shield]] - which can be either used separately, or combined to form a large [[axe]].

The strategy of using the weapon's two forms generally revolves around using the sword to charge energy and the shield for defense, then using the energy by switching to axe mode to deliver large amounts of damage.

body:
Character in [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]] and member of the Black Eagles.

Ferdinand is a confident and competitive noble, he strives to become better than [[Edelgard von Hresvelg|Edelgard]] in order to prove himself. Unlike other nobles, he does not look down upon commoners as many other nobles do. He is willing to understand what he did wrong and desires to improve himself when someone takes issue of him.

title: sylvain_jose_gautier
body:
Playable character in [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]] and member of the Blue Lions.

While he values his friends and acts as an older brother figure to them, he has a habit of being a skirt chaser and often ends up getting in trouble as a result, he is childhood friends with [[Dimitri Alexandre Blaiddyd|Dimitri]], [[Felix Hugo Fraldarius|Felix]] and [[Ingrid Brandl Galatea|Ingrid]].

In-game, Sylvain is a balanced and flexible character who initially serves best as a Cavalier, but can fit into virtually any role with enough effort, with only his Dexterity being slightly below average.

Voiced by: Joe Brogie (English), [[Furukawa Makoto]] (Japanese).

title: kanojo_okarishimasu
body:
A romcom manga series written and illustrated by [[Miyajima Reiji]], first published in 2017.
The male protagonist [[Kinoshita Kazuya]], gets dumped by his girlfriend [[Nanami Mami]]. To relieve his sorrow, he decides to try out a "girlfriend" rental service, and there he meets the breathtaking beauty [[Mizuhara Chizuru]]. As the professional she is, she keeps "business" and private separate. Soon, however, their private lives start to get intermingled in ways none of them could imagine...

An anime adaptation by TMS Entertainment aired from July to September 2020, and there is a second season airing in Summer 2022.

English Title: [i]Rent-a-Girlfriend[/i]

h4. Characters

* [[Kinoshita Kazuya]]
* [[Mizuhara Chizuru]]
* [[Nakano Umi]]
* [[Nanami Mami]]
* [[Sakurasawa Sumi]]
* [[Sarashina Ruka]]
* [[Yaemori Mini]]

h4. See also

title: donnel_(fire_emblem)
body:
Donnel ([b]Denis[/b] in Japan, [b]Donnel Tinhead[/b] in the Western version) is a character of the Villager class in [[Fire Emblem Awakening]].

A young man from the countryside that joins the Shepherds after they protect his town from being razed by bandits. He has an astonishing learning ability, reflected by his Aptitude perk in-game, which allows him to increase each of his stats each time he reaches a level.

He can be obtained during the first Paralogue. If he reaches Level 4 at any point during the Paralogue, he will automatically join your party at the end.

Voiced by Ichiki Mitshuhiro in the Japanese version and Sam Riegel in the NA version.

h4. Appearance

* !post #8576351
* !post #8478287: [[donnel (summer) (fire emblem)|Summer]]

title: dakimakura_(medium)
body:
A dakimakura is a Japanese [[body pillow]] printed with anime characters, usually as a [[full body|full-length portrait]], [[lying]] on [[bed sheet]]s, and frequently in a state of [[undressing|undress]] or nightwear.

Many dakimakura are two-sided, showing the character clothed on one side and [[nude]] (or less clothed) on the other. These dakimakura should be tagged [[multiple views]] and not [[solo]].

Use this tag for images featuring dakimakura designs, such as post #900422.  When a dakimakura is included as an object in the picture, use [[dakimakura (object)]] instead.

Use [[double dakimakura (medium)|]] for dakis that have two characters in them.

title: tabi
body:
A kind of traditional Japanese [[socks|sock]]. Modern tabi resemble regular socks, only there is a division between the big toe and the other toes, and the soles are usually thicker. Historically, Tabi are commonly made of inelastic materials such as [[leather]] and cotton and have fasteners at the back due to its origin as indoor footwear, but modern Tabi also use stretchable fabrics. For socks with division between all toes use [[toe socks]] instead. 

For tabi that are used as footwear, use [[jika-tabi]] instead.

title: frank_tenpenny
body:
Frank Tenpenny is a character and main antagonist in [[Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas]]. 

A corrupt Los Santos police officer, he leads [b]CRASH[/b] (Community Resources Against Street Hoodlums), a police unit originally created to combat the gangs of Los Santos and the rising illegal drug trade, but has since become corrupt by also being involved in criminal activities including working with the drug gangs. Throughout the game, Tenpenny forces the main character [[Carl Johnson]] to help him cover up his corruption by threatening his family. 

Tenpenny is voiced by [[Samuel L. Jackson]] while the character is based on [[real life]] [[Los Angeles]] Police officer Rafael Pérez, who was arrested for his crimes in the late 1990s when the CRASH unit he was in was exposed for corruption.

title: list_of_commonly_misused_tags
body:
h4. Mutually exclusive tags

The following cannot be used to describe the same object or situation

* [[ambiguous gender]] <-> [[androgynous]]
* [[bare pectorals]] <-> ([[topless male]], [[nude]], [[breastless clothes]] or [[underwear only]])
* [[bottomless]] <-> [[bare legs]] 
* [[greyscale]] <-> [[grey theme]]
* [[hands in opposite sleeves]] <-> [[sleeves past wrists]]
* [[hairband]] <-> [[headband]]
* [[jersey]] <-> [[track jacket]]
* [[looking at viewer]] <-> ([[facing viewer]] or [[closed eyes]] or [[blindfold]])
* [[nude]] <-> ([[bare shoulders]] or [[bare legs]] or [[bare arms]] or [[topless female]] or [[bottomless]])
* [[official alternate costume]] <-> [[alternate costume]]
** [[official alternate hairstyle]] <-> [[alternate hairstyle]]
** [[official alternate hair length]] <-> [[alternate hair length]]
* ([[off-shoulder shirt]]/[[off-shoulder dress|dress]]/[[off-shoulder sweater|sweater]]) <-> ([[strapless]] [[strapless shirt|shirt]]/[[strapless dress|dress]] or [[tube top]]) <-> ([[sleeveless]] [[sleeveless shirt|shirt]]/[[sleeveless dress|dress]]/[[sleeveless sweater|sweater]])
* [[playboy bunny]] <-> ([[kittysuit]] or [[rabbit costume]])
* [[solo]] <-> ([[solo focus]] or [[multiple views]])
* [[striped bikini]] <-> [[white bikini]]
* [[topless female]] <-> ([[nude]] or [[bare shoulders]] or [[bare arms]])
* [[x-ray]] <-> [[cross-section]]
* [[miko]] <-> [[nontraditional miko]]

h4. Specific mistagging

h5. Places

* [[changing room]]/[[dressing room]]/[[fitting room]]/[[locker room]]
** Not to be used interchangeably for just any rooms where a character would get dressed and/or undressed.
** [[Changing room]]s are the ones where people remove and store their clothes, usually when going to a [[pool]] or an [[onsen]].
** [[Dressing room]]s are the ones used by on-stage performers to change in and out of their costumes.
** [[Fitting room]]s are the tiny ones in clothing stores where individual customers can try on clothes before buying them.
** [[Locker room]]s are similar to changing rooms, but [[locker]]s must be visible.

h5. Objects

* [[animal ears]]
** Do not use for actual animals, which have these by default.
* [[costume switch]]
** Applicable only if there are multiple characters, to be sure there is a switch.
** Not applicable on single-character [[cosplay]] pictures. Add the appropriate cosplay tag instead.
** Not applicable on parent-child pairs of single-character [[cosplay]] posts.
** Not the same as a "costume change."
* [[crescent moon]]
** Do not tag for just [[crescent]] shaped objects, e.g. [[crescent hair ornament]]
* [[goat horns]]
** Commonly mistagged on [[sheep horns]]. Goat horns traditionally do not curl all the way around.
* [[naked towel]]
** Character must be wearing the towel, not just having it on their person
* [[no humans]]
** Does not apply to human-like characters such as [[humanoid robot]]s and [[furry|furries]].
* [[off-shoulder jacket]]/[[off-shoulder coat]]/[[off-shoulder cardigan]]
** Should be used when the jacket, coat, or cardigan is naturally designed with a low and wide-cut neckline.
** Do not use for open/partially open jackets/coats/cardigans that are simply worn hanging off the upper arms.
* [[red glasses]]
** See either [[red-framed eyewear]] or [[red-tinted eyewear]]
* [[see-through clothes]]/[[transparent]]
** See-through is for clothing, transparent is for other objects.
* [[short hair]]
** Not for [[medium hair|shoulder-length hair]]
* [[silhouette]]
** Not for mere [[shadow]]s behind objects; should be mostly featureless
* [[vaginal]]
** If female character's genital is visible, tagging [[pussy]] is mandatory. 
* [[miko]]
** Only to be used if a character is wearing the actual traditional outfit of a miko: a [[hakama skirt]] (almost always entirely red) and white kosode or kimono. Otherwise, use [[nontraditional miko]] instead.

h5. Meta

* [[casual]]
** Not for characters that always appear in casual clothing
* [[contemporary]]
** Not for characters that always appear in contemporary settings
* [[humanization]]
** Refers to characters that were already humanoid to begin with being depicted as fully human; depictions of non-humanoids as humans belong under [[personification]]
* [[orc]] and [[ogre]]
** Orcs are commonly depicted with a green-skinned muscular or chubby body and sports a tusks, while ogres usually have a fat body and lacks any tusks.
* [[text focus]]
** Only when text is a major component of an image

h5. Actions

* [[squirting liquid]]
** Not for [[female ejaculation]]
* [[facing viewer]]
** Only for characters with [[closed eyes|closed]] or [[covered eyes]]
* [[floating]]
** When on water, use [[afloat]] instead
* [[partially submerged]]
** Not for just [[sitting]] in [[shallow water]]
* [[air guitar]]
** This is for pretending to play a guitar [i]without holding anything[/i]. Pretending to play guitar with anything but a guitar is using an [[unconventional guitar]].
* [[riding]]
** Only for characters riding an [[animal]] or a [[motor vehicle]], use [[girl on top]] or [[boy on top]], and [[cowgirl position]] for posts depicting a person having sex on top of another person.
* [[takeoff]]
** Only for characters or [[aircraft]]s leaving the ground. Use [[undressing]] for images depicting someone taking off their clothes.

h4. See also

* topic #14603 (Commonly misused tags)

title: lunasia_(girls'_frontline)
body:
A character in [[Girls' Frontline]].

[spoiler]Though her precise origins were unknown at first, clones of hers with altered memories would be sent on a quest for vengeance against G&K, resulting in their deaths. Upon recovering one of the bodies and discovering the similarity her brain appeared to have to a T-Doll's Neural Cloud, [[Persica (girls' frontline)|]] went ahead and scanned the corpse's brain, utilizing the data to create a Neural Cloud model. She would lend a copy to former colleague [[Lycoris (girls' frontline)|]], who'd go on to create [[Elisa (girls' frontline)|]] with it, while Persica would use the model to create the [[Anti-Rain (girls' frontline)|AR Team]], using varying amounts of the scans for each member, [[M4A1 (girls' frontline)|]] embodying the most, and [[RO635 (girls' frontline)|]] the least, with her instead using it as a basis for the next gen of dolls, making her more stable and duplicable.

As a result of the amount of scan data that was used for her, M4A1 would be recognized by Elisa and [[Dandelion (girls' frontline)|her OGAS]] as "Lunasia."[/spoiler]
[spoiler]The [[Nyto (girls' frontline)|]]s bare a resemblance to not just M4A1, but Lunasia as well, and it would be revealed that not only is the leader of [[Paradeus]] [[William (reverse collapse)|]], but that he had been the one to make the clones. The intent behind his usage of Lunasia as a cloning specimen becomes clearer from Chapter 13 on, once it is revealed that he is in fact the brother to the original Lunasia (and in turn, daughter of [[Rudolf von Oberstein]]).[/spoiler]
[spoiler]The events in Cartesian Theater and Angular Gyrus (Chapter 15.2/15.4) would see Lunasia return through the possession of M4A1's body, for reasons which this wiki page is not fit to explain.[/spoiler]

Shares a similar name to one of the Three Goddesses of [[Codename: Bakery Girl]], translated into English as Lunasia too (露尼西亚 in GF vs. 露尼西娅 in Bakery Girl; the distinction has prompted some to continue using the older fan-translation of Lunixya for this character). She's otherwise distinguished as "Test Subject G-264 Lunasia".

h4. Appearance

* !post #6584844: Young Lunasia
* !post #6584804: "Poincaré Recurrence" event hologram (M4A1-inspired)
* !post #9024444: In Frankfurt (example)

h4. See also

* [[List of Girls' Frontline characters]]

h4. External links

* "IOP Wiki: Lunasia":[https://iopwiki.com/wiki/Lunasia]

title: subnautica
body:
A 2018 survival game developed by Unknown Worlds Entertainment.

The player controls [[Ryley Robinson]], a survivor of a spaceship crash on an alien oceanic planet, which they are free to explore. The game features a large variety of fictional sea creatures and submersible equipment/vehicles.

A sequel, [[Subnautica Below Zero]], was released in 2019.

Unfortunately for her, her attempts to pursue her colleague are often sabotaged by other women, including her rival [[Kouhai-chan (douki-chan)|]] and [[Senpai-san (douki-chan)|]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] in a [[short ponytail]] and usually wears a blue [[dress shirt]] with a [[pencil skirt]], red underwear and [[see-through legwear|sheer]] [[brown pantyhose]].

title: pirassununga_51
body: Pirassununga 51 is a well-known brand of cachaça, a Brazilian distilled spirit made from sugarcane juice. It is one of the most widely consumed cachaças in Brazil and abroad. Due to its strong association with Brazilian culture, it is frequently used in caipirinhas and other cocktails and used as reference for arts featuring Cachaça bottles. The brand is recognizable by its white label with red and gold accents, featuring the number "51" prominently.

Xiao guan that resemble crowns are also called shufa guan, and in Korean, sangtugwan.

title: espresso_cookie
body:
[[Cookie Run: Kingdom]] playable character of the Magic class. He debuted on January 21st 2021. 

Hailing from the Crème Republic, Espresso Cookie is a pioneer and proponent of Coffee Magic, researching and experimenting through many sleepless nights to constantly refine his craft. This [[wizard]] occasionally teaches classes on Coffee Magic at the Parfaedia Institute. A serious, intellectual and confident perfectionist with workaholic tendencies and a heart of gold.

He has [[dark-skinned male|dark skin]], [[brown eyes]] with [[slit pupils]] and [[brown hair|brown]]/[[black hair|black]] [[short hair]] with [[hair over one eye]] and [[white hair|white]] [[streaked hair]]. He wears [[round eyewear|round]] [[glasses]].

His outfit is commonly agreed to be consisted of a [[black robe]], [[black cape]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[pink necktie]] and [[black footwear]], though there are variations depending on each artist’s interpretation. 

His English VA is [[Zach Aguilar]].

h4. Costumes

title: blaze_the_cat
body:
Character from the [[sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog]] series. She's a purple anthropomorphic [[cat girl]], who made her debut in the 2005 release of [[Sonic Rush]]. She was designed by Akinori Nishiyama, and since then has been a reoccurring character. 

Blaze is [[sonic the hedgehog|Sonic]] from an alternate dimension, or a friend of [[silver the hedgehog|Silver]] from an alternate future depending on the game you go off of. She's the guardian of the Sol Emeralds and has pyrokinetic abilities.

She has been voiced by Erica Schroeder, [[Laura Bailey]], and [[Erica Lindbeck]].

title: them's_fightin'_herds
body:
Fighting game focused on cartoon hooved animals developed by Mane6 and published by Modus Games. Released in 2020.

Originally developed as the [[My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic]] fan game "Fighting is Magic" before receiving a cease and desist from Hasbro due to attention drawn to the early build of the game at EVO. Creator of FiM [[Lauren Faust]] offered to create original character designs for the game, and thus it was spun into its own IP.

The game runs on the Z-Engine, the engine designed by the team behind [[Skullgirls]].

The game ceased development in 2024 after the release of its final two DLC characters.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Them's Fightin' Herds":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Them's_Fightin'_Herds

title: sprunki
body:
Sprunki is a horror [[Incredibox]] mod that originated from the Scratch website made by NyankoBfLol, later officially ported to Incredimake before it got taken down.

[spoilers]The gameplay is the same as Incredibox as it is a mod. You drag one of the 20 character icons on the bottom of the screen onto one of the 7 empty polos. However, once you drag the Black top-hat icon, the game will go into horror mode after a temporary black screen, with all the characters being either injured, insane, or traumatized.
There is also a reset button on the top right corner of the screen that resets the characters.[/spoilers] 


* !asset #24086729

h4. See also 

* [[Incredibox]]

title: vinsmoke_reiju
body:
[[One Piece]] character. The eldest sister of the Vinsmoke family and [[Sanji (one piece)|]]'s older sister. She is the princess of the Germa kingdom and served as one of the commanders of the Germa 66 army.

Like the rest of her family, she is genetically-modified to become a super-soldier, as such she possesses superhuman strength in addition of her natural ability to create and absorb poison.

title: jet_jaguar
body:
A giant [[robot]] from [[Godzilla (series)|]] series. First appeared in [i]Godzilla vs. Megalon[/i]

Jet Jaguar was initially built as a human-sized robot, but after being kidnapped by the Sepia people, Jet Jaguar (somehow) became self-aware and gained an ability to dramatically increase his size, to which he used this new ability to fight any hostile kaiju and protect humanity.

Jet Jaguar's characteristic, particularly its color scheme, is a rather obvious spoof to the rival [[Ultra Series]].

h4. See also

* [[Jet Jaguar (Singular Point)]]

title: mahou_shoujo_madoka_magica_plus
body:
A now-defunct [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]] mobile game, released on November 19th, 2012, to replace [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Mobage]].

It did not introduce any new characters, though it did feature a high amount of costumes for the series' original cast and a collaboration with [[Nisekoi]].

It featured a plethora of cards with costumes for the anime's cast, and later down the line, [[Momoe Nagisa]] as well.

Not to be confused with [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Plus]], a later game which also used the Mobage portal, whose dedicated booru is named simply "''mobage''":[https://mobage.booru.org/index.php].

title: hijirisawa_shonosuke
body:
An unnamed extra character from [i][[Osomatsu-kun]][/i]. His first appearance was as a robber that [[matsuno_osomatsu|Osomatsu]] and [[matsuno_choromatsu|Choromatsu]] encountered. In [i][[Osomatsu-san]][/i], he appears as a recurring minor character and gains the name Hijirisawa Shonosuke. He also appears to have gained 17 identical siblings.

He is a short, bald man with a [[unibrow]], [[buck teeth]], and thin, long mustache.

title: holi_festival
body:
A [[spring (season)|spring festival]] known as the "Festival of Colors", originating as a Hindu religious festival in [[India]] and [[Nepal]] which has since become popular with people of other communities, especially overseas Hindus. 

The epithet "Festival of Colors" comes from the dousing of colored water and powder normally associated with the Holi festivities.

title: note
body:
Use when information of any sort (typically written, may involve pictures) is being conveyed through a single sheet of [[paper]], which may or may not have been ripped out of a [[notebook]] or similar.

Often stuck on walls with [[tape]] or [[nail (hardware)|nail]]s, sometimes just left on surfaces like [[bed]]s or [[table]]s.

For musical notation, use [[musical note]] instead.

title: set500_(mcdonald's)
body:
A character introduced by [[McDonald's]] Japan to advertise its medium-sized low cost combo meals for 500 yen.

Its design consists of a [[robot girl]] with [[white hair]], [[black eyes]] and [[mechanical arms]] and [[mechanical legs|legs]] with no joints, wearing a [[red hairband]] with [[fake antennae]], a white [[skirt set]] composed of a [[white shirt]] with a [[screen]] and a [[white skirt]], [[red gloves]], [[red shoes|shoes]] and a pair of [[sphere earrings]].

Is often accompanied by a smaller robot with a single antenna and a [[wheel]].

title: mystic_knights_of_tir_na_nog
body: Western live-action series created by Saban Entertainment (creators of [[Power Rangers]]), Renaissance-Atlantic Films (co-creators of PR), and Sharpmist, Ltd. (based at Ardmore Studios), and produced in Ireland. A fantasy-adventure series loosely based on [[Irish mythology]], derived from Tír na nÓg, one of the Otherworlds of Irish mythology. One of the rare attempts at Western [[tokusatsu]] during the 90s, alongside DIC's [[Tattooed Teenage Alien Fighters from Beverly Hills]].
other_names: ミスティック・ナイツ・オブ・ティル・ナ・ノーグ

title: ken_masters
body:
[b]Ken Masters[/b] is a video game character created by [[Capcom]]. He is one of the main characters from the [[Street Fighter]] series of fighting games alongside [[Ryu (street fighter)|]]. 

Ken was initially created as a [[palette swap]] for [[player 2]] in the first Street Fighter title and thus used an identical moveset to that of Ryu's in early installments, though Capcom later on decided to make the two distinct by making Ken being more specialized on [[Shouryuuken]] in parallel with Ryu's [[Hadouken]].

Ken has a wife, [[Eliza Masters|Eliza]] and a son, [[Mel Masters|Mel]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #234930: [[Street Fighter II (series)|]]
* !post #464239: [[Street Fighter Zero (series)|]]
* !post #1278523: [[Street Fighter III (series)|]]
* !post #309883: [[Street Fighter IV (series)|]]
* !post #2064059: [[Street Fighter V]]
* !post #6222101: [[Street Fighter 6]]


h4. Known moves

* [[Hadouken]]

* [[Shouryuuken]]
** Shouryuu Reppa
** Shinryuuken

* [[Tatsumaki Senpuukyaku]]
** Shippuu Jinraikyaku
** Guren Senpuukyaku

h4. Alternate Forms

* [[Violent Ken]] ([[SvC Chaos]] and [[Street Fighter II (series)|Ultra Street Fighter II: The Final Challengers]])
* [[Soaring Falcon Ranger]] ([[Power Rangers: Battle for the Grid]])
other_names: ケン(ストリートファイター)

title: let's_kill_da_ho!
body:
[i]"Okay master, let's kill da ho! Beech!!"[/i]

A [[meme]] from [[Diamond wa Kudakenai]] originated from the quote of [[Echoes (stand)|]] [[Echoes ACT3|ACT 3]] to his master [[Hirose Koichi]], after the nurse declined the request to visit [[Kishibe Rohan]] and mocking his stature, just before using his power to knock her out and force their way in.

This quote is often associated with [[Amano Pikamee]] and [[Hikasa Tomoshika]] from [[VOMS]] due to a popular clip involving Tomoshika repeatedly said "Let's kill da ho!" without even knowing its actual meaning.

title: california_king_bed

title: ichinose_yuri
body:
Supporting character in [i][[Gundam Breaker Mobile]][/i]. A high-spirited genki girl from Nippa High. She began Gunpla battling so she could fight against her two older brothers. She wasn't able to win against them by playing normally, so she picked up a few more unconventional tricks. Her goal is to have fun playing with other people and therefore doesn't mind losing as long as she has fun. She is also a notorious autograph hound.

After competing with them in various tournaments, she befriends the Soukai Academy Gunpla Club as a friendly rival and frequent sparring partner. Often paired with [[Kotomori Ren]] as an outsider odd-couple friend duo. Her romantic interest is routinely implied to be [[Nogami Kenji]].

Typically seen in her simple [[school uniform]] consisting of a [[dress shirt]] and [[plaid_skirt|plaid]] [[pleated_skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], over which she wears a thick [[orange jacket]]. Wears her [[short_hair|short]] [[brown hair]] tied in a [[high ponytail]] like a [[topknot]]. Has markedly [[large_breasts|larger breasts]] than most of the female cast, rivalling even the adults.

Gunpla:
- [[Gundam Astray Red Frame Flame]]

title: boxcutter
body:
A [[knife]], also known as a utility knife, with a replaceable blade used for cutting open boxes.

These types of knives come in two basic forms: a solid blade or a snap(off) blade. The solid blade uses a single solid blade that requires replacing when it become dull. The snap blade design uses a single long segmented blade with which you can snap off the leading end when it dulls to once again have a sharp tip. The blade can then be replaced after you run out of usable segments.

The most common style depicted on Danbooru is the snap blade design; this may be due to the fact that the snap blade design was introduced by a Japanese company in 1956. 

It is often featured with themes of [[self-harm]].

h4. Examples

* !post #19284: solid blade
* !post #7406913: snap(off) blade

h4. See also

* [[razor blade]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Utility Knife":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Utility_knife]

title: allie_summers_(parasyte123)
body:
Original character belonging to artist Parasyte123 - Allie is actually an alternate timeline version of his main OC, Elly Hamilton, who fell into a wormhole that transported her to the main timeline while on a mission that saw the deaths of her closest friends and first husband. The transition between timelines turned her eyes and hair a different color. The only memento she has of her original world is the pendant around her neck, a gift from her late husband.

Her daughter, [[Sephira Summers (Parasyte123)]] came from yet another timeline.

title: howto:character
body:
In images on Danbooru, all identifiable characters should be tagged and their tag set as a character tag.

h5. What defines a character?

Generally, it is self-evident who are characters and what aren't. For example, [[Edward Elric]], [[Pikachu]], and [[Simon (ttgl)|]] are obviously characters, while the [[philosopher's stone]], [[Ecruteak City]], and the [[core drill]] are not.

However, sometimes it isn't as clear cut. While there is no official policy on what a character is, the unofficial rule of thumb seems to be: [b]If it talks, acts on its own, or is otherwise shown to be sentient in the source material (game, anime, manga, novel), it is a character.[/b]

Thus, something can be considered a character even if it is an object, for example [[Bardiche (nanoha)|]] or Plankton's computer wife [[Karen (spongebob)|]].

h5. What types of things SHOULD NOT be a character tag?

Locations and non-[[mecha]] vehicles are not characters. (See forum #34022)

Sometimes, artists draw an object (computer, software, vehicle, food, etc.) as a humanoid. This is called a [[personification]]. However, the object is still not considered a character, so it should remain a general tag. If the personified version becomes a character in its own right, a separate character tag can be created for it. For example, [[strawberry]] is the food and [[strawberry-chan]] is the personification.

h5. How to make a character tag.

To make a tag be a character tag, prefix it with "character:" or "char:". Remember to replace spaces with underscores (like_this).

h6. Name and Name Order

Character tags should be the same name and name order that are used in the original source material. For example, [[Kiyama Hiroto]], not "Hiroto Kiyama" or "Xavier Foster". If an alternate name, such as a nickname or a name from the English version, is widely used, you may "request an alias":[/bulk_update_requests/new] from that to the original language title.

However, some copyrights are [b]exceptions[/b] to this rule. Characters from the following should be tagged with their [b]English-language names[/b] when possible:
* [b][[Ace Attorney]] (Gyakuten Saiban)[/b]
* [b][[Advance Wars]] (Famicom Wars)[/b]
* [b][[Animal Crossing]] (Doubutsu no Mori)[/b]
* [b][[Castlevania (series)|]] (Akumajou Dracula)[/b]
* [b][[Final Fantasy]][/b]
* [b][[Fire Emblem]][/b]
** <tn>To be tagged with the names used in the North American localizations (preferably [i]Fire Emblem Heroes[/i]). See topic #16149.</tn>
* [b][[Golden Sun]] (Ougon no Taiyou)[/b]
* [b][[Granblue Fantasy]][/b]
* [b][[Kid Icarus]] (Hikari Shinwa)[/b]
* [b][[Mario (series)|]][/b]
* [b][[Mega Man (series)|]] (Rockman)[/b]
* [b][[Monster Hunter (series)|]][/b]
* [b][[Pokemon]][/b] (human and creature)
* [b][[Splatoon (series)|]][/b]
* [b][[Tales of (series)|Tales of...]][/b]
* [b][[Xenoblade Chronicles (series)|]][/b]

h6. Follow [[howto:romanize]].

If you are unsure how to romanize the character's name, ask in a comment or on the forum.

h6. Only one name?

Whenever possible, characters should be tagged with their full name. However, some characters are only known by a single name (like [[Chen]]). Other times, their full name may be considered a spoiler. Usually these should be tagged with the single name, adding a _(series) qualifier if it is ambiguous. (See [[help:qualifiers]])
If only their surname is known (e.g. same as their spouse or children), or if the full name is not well-known, it may be appropriate to tag them Mr. or Mrs. Surname. (or Dr. or Professor, etc)

Examples:

* [[asuna_(sao)]]
* [[yamada_(b-gata_h-kei)]]
* [[bobby_(fma)]]
* [[yuki_(touhou)]]
* [[mrs._bradley]]
* [[mr._koiwai]]

However, if a character is from a game which is self-titled (title comes from character's name, resulting in a [code]character_(series)[/code] copyright tags), it should be left off. Example:

* [[Mario]] of [[Mario (Series)]]
* [[Kirby]] of [[Kirby (Series)]]

In the case of [[original]] characters, the tag should be qualified using the name of the person who designed it. This includes artists as well as non-artists, such as commissioners. The qualifier should be consistent with the name of the artist tag used on the site. Examples:

* [[Lokulo-chan (Lokulo no Mawashimono)]] by the artist [[Lokulo no Mawashimono]]
* [[Alyssa (SpeckTech)]] by the commissioner SpeckTech

h6. No name!

If the character has no known name but is still recognizable in images (or if their name is a [[spoilers|spoiler]]), a succinct description can be used as a tag for them. If there is consensus among how fans of the series refer to them, use that. If the tag may be ambiguous, add a _(series) or _(artist) qualifier for copyrighted and [[original]] characters respectively.

Copyrighted examples:

* [[idoko]]
* [[idoko's_stepsister]]
* [[giha_village_chief]]
* [[nurse_(katawa_shoujo)]]
* [[girl_with_bear_(madoka_magica)]]
* [[lady_in_red_(ib)]]
* [[mysterious_boy_(angel_beats!)]]
* [[man_with_watch]]
* [[kyon's sister]]
* [[girl_from_the_illusionary_world]]
* [[jyushimatsu's_girlfriend]]

[[Original]] examples:

* [[Red Girl (Yuuhagi (Amaretto-no-Natsu))]]
* [[Black-haired Demon Girl (Shimmer)]]
* [[Big Sister (navigavi)]]

h6. Titles and honorifics

Generally, characters do not have honorifics or titles in their names, as the honorific changes depending on who is addressing the character. However, some characters have the honorific or title as a permanent part of their name such as [[Chouzetsusaikawa Tenshi-chan]] or [[Mr. C.B. (umamusume)|]] In these cases, keep the honorific or title intact. In cases where a character is frequently addressed by their title, a utility alias can be created to help find the character, such as the alias from Arthur Kirkland -> [[United Kingdom (Hetalia)]].

h6. Alternate identities, [[genderswap]]s, and other derivatives

If a character has alternate identities or forms which are visually distinct, these are tagged as well. Use the official name, or if there is none, the agreed-upon fan referent. [b]Alternate forms may be [[spoilers|spoiler]], so be careful when tagging.[/b] Depending on the situation, the tag for the regular identity may be used with the alternate identity as well. Alternate identity tags may be character-type or general-type; again, it depends on the situation.

Examples:

* [[awakened_miki]]
* [[sakura_miku]]
* [[ex-keine]]
* [[kyonko]]

Not every genderswap gets their own character tag; only the ones that are popular enough to have established genderswap names.

Exception is for younger or older versions of the character, these are covered by the regular character tag, plus whichever applicable age tags: [[aged down]], [[baby]], [[toddler]], [[child]], [[aged up]], [[old_woman]], [[old_man]], etc.

h6. Cosplays - One character wearing another's costume

Add both characters tags (the cosplayer and character they're dressing as) and a third general *_(cosplay) tag for the costume. So [[yakumo ran|Ran]] wearing a Pikachu suit would need:

* [[cosplay]]
* [[yakumo_ran]]
* [[pikachu_(cosplay)]]
* [[pikachu]] 

This can be accomplished by just tagging [[yakumo_ran]] and [[pikachu_(cosplay)]], as cosplay tags automatically imply both the character tag and the [[cosplay]] tag.
(see forum #1261)

title: jamila_pose
body:
A pose done to make oneself resemble the character [[Jamila (ultra series)|]] from [[Ultraman (1st series)|]]. By pushing the neckline of one's shirt all the way to the top of your head, so that your face can be seen flush with it, you end up recreating Jamila's appearance as a headless being with his face at the top of his chest by his shoulders.

In the West, the most well-known depiction of the Jamila pose is from [[Kill Me Baby]]'s [[Kill Me Dance]], where recreating it serves as the 12th step in the dance out of 16.

h4. See also

* Pixpedia: "ジャミラ (ネタ要員として)":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%82%B8%E3%83%A3%E3%83%9F%E3%83%A9#h3_21]

title: daidouji_tomoyo_(chef:_tomoyo)
body:
A costume that [[Daidouji Tomoyo]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically during the ending credits song for the third season, titled [i]Fruits Candy[/i]. [[Kinomoto Sakura]] likewise has a [[kinomoto sakura (shopgirl: mint)|Fruits Candy costume]] of her own.

Tomoyo's costume consists of a [[pink bow|pink]] [[hair bow]], a [[pink dress]] beneath a [[white apron]], [[white socks]], and [[pink footwear|pink]] [[slippers]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(constellations)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in [[cardcaptor sakura clear card arc|Clear Card Arc]], specifically in episode 7. Take care not to confuse this outfit with her [[kinomoto sakura (night star)|Yellow Star costume]] from the 90s anime.

She wears star ornaments in her hair, a pale [[yellow dress]] with puffy sleeves and star ornaments, [[white pantyhose]], and pale [[yellow footwear|yellow]] [[shoes]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(silk_ribbon)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in [[cardcaptor sakura clear card arc|Clear Card Arc]], specifically in episode 2.

She wears a [[pink hat]] with striped ribbons, a striped bow on the front of a [[pink capelet]], a [[pink dress]], [[white gloves]], a striped ribbon on her right leg, and [[pink thighhighs|pink]] [[thigh boots]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(lotus)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in [[cardcaptor sakura clear card arc|Clear Card Arc]], specifically in episode 4.

She wears a Chinese-themed blue-and-yellow shirt with lotus flower print on the front, [[blue pants]], and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[shoes]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(frog)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in [[cardcaptor sakura clear card arc|Clear Card Arc]], specifically in episode 3.

As the name implies, she wears a [[green coat|green]] [[raincoat]] modeled after a [[frog]], along with a [[frog hood]], [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[green sleeves]], [[white socks|white]] [[kneehighs]], and [[green footwear|green]] [[boots]].

* !asset #22975406

h4. Other media
* This outfit appears as a costume for [[Amitie (puyopuyo)|]] in [[Puyopuyo Quest]], called {{Amitie_(kinomoto_sakura)_(puyopuyo)|Amitie ver. Kinomoto Sakura}}.

title: kinomoto_sakura_(blaze)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in [[cardcaptor sakura clear card arc|Clear Card Arc]], specifically in episode 18.

She wears a flame-themed hair ornament, a [[red shirt]], puffy [[white pants]] with orange flame patterns at the bottom, a loose belt around her waist, and [[red footwear|red]] [[shoes]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(red_blue)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 15 when she captures the [[Storm (clow card)|]] Card.

She wears a [[blue hat|blue]] [[witch hat]], a two-sided blue and red cape with a wing brooch, a [[black shirt]], [[black gloves]], [[blue shorts]], [[blue thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

title: big_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the 34 cards introduced in the anime, capable of growing people and objects in size. Its opposing card is the [[Little (clow card)|]] card. Sakura captures it in episode 31, and is used to make Sakura grow in size to fight a pink dragon that the [[Create (clow card)|]] card made. She wears her [[kinomoto sakura (hero)|Warrior costume]] when capturing both cards.

title: create_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the 34 cards introduced in the anime, capable of bringing creatures or objects into existence. It is captured in episode 31, when Sakura uses the [[Big (clow card)|]] to grow in size to challenge a pink dragon that the Create card made. She wears her [[kinomoto sakura (hero)|Warrior costume]] to capture both cards in this episode.

title: kinomoto_sakura_(hero)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 31 when she captures both the [[Big (clow card)|]] and [[Create (clow card)|]] Cards.

She wears a pair of yellow wing ornaments in her hair, a blue-and-white form-fitting set of shorts with a yellow winged motif over the shoulders, a pair of large [[blue ribbon]]s on the back, and [[blue thighhighs|blue]] [[thigh boots]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(commander)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 50 when she rescues [[Li Syaoran]] using the [[Sword (clow card)|]] Card's power.

She wears a [[grey hat]], a [[white jacket]] over a white-and-grey dress, [[grey gloves]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[thigh boots]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(memories)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 16 when she visits her great-grandfather. It used to belong to her mother [[Kinomoto Nadeshiko]], who was a fan of Victorian-themed clothing.

She wears a [[white hat]] with a wide brim and [[black bow]], a [[white dress]] beneath a layer of red fabric, a black [[waist bow]], [[white socks]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(winter_bunny)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 36 when she captures the [[Snow (clow card)|]] Card.

She wears a red rabbit-themed winter coat, [[orange gloves]], [[yellow bloomers]], [[white pantyhose]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[boots]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(macaron)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 20 when she captures the [[Fight (clow card)|]] Card.

She wears a [[pink hat]] with a [[pink bow]], a distinctly puffy [[pink dress]] with a [[white bow]] on the front and back, [[white gloves]], [[white pantyhose]], and [[pink footwear|pink]] [[mary janes]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(rainy_night_sakura)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 47 when she tries to change the [[Clow Card]]s into [[Sakura Card]]s.

She wears an [[orange hat|orange]] [[jester cap]], a two-sided yellow and blue [[cape]], [[orange shorts]], [[orange gloves]], and [[yellow thighhighs|yellow]] [[thigh boots]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(white_bunny)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 6 when she attempts to capture the [[Illusion (clow card)|]] Card but fails.

She dons a pair of white [[rabbit ears]], a [[blue leotard]] with yellow [[pom pom (clothes)|pom poms]], puffy [[pink sleeves]] and [[pink shorts]], a yellow [[rabbit tail]], [[white pantyhose]], and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[shoes]] with yellow pom poms.

title: kinomoto_sakura_(starlit_dream)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 59 when she transforms the [[Shadow (clow card)|]] Card.

She wears a [[purple hat]] with a pink star ornament, a [[purple capelet]], a [[pink dress]], [[purple gloves]], and [[purple thighhighs|purple]] [[thigh boots]].

title: thunder_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the original 19 cards from the manga, capable of manipulating electricity. Sakura captures it in episode 8 with help from the [[Shadow (clow card)|]] card. She wears her [[kinomoto sakura (kitty)|Pink Kitty costume]] while capturing the Thunder card.

title: kinomoto_sakura_(kitty)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 8 when she captures the [[Thunder (clow card)|]] Card.

She wears a pair of black [[cat ears]], a [[black dress]] layered beneath another [[pink dress]], a [[jingle bell]] over her neck, [[black pantyhose]], and [[pink footwear|pink]] [[boots]]. In the manga, the pink dress is colored [[white dress|white]] instead.

title: kinomoto_sakura_(twin_night)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in both the 90s anime and manga, specifically in episode 43 when she captures the [[Twin (clow card)|]] Card, and in chapter 13 of the manga when she captures the [[Shield (clow card)|]] Card.

She wears a [[pink hat]], a [[pink jacket]] with black trim, [[black gloves]], [[black shorts]], and [[black thighhighs|black]] [[thigh boots]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(awakened_sakura)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 48 when she transformed the [[Firey (clow card)|]] Card into a Star Card.

She wears a [[pink hat]], a [[pink skirt]], [[yellow gloves]], cream-colored shorts, and pink-and-cream colored [[boots]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(musical_notes)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 23 when she captures the [[Song (clow card)|]] Card.

She wears a [[pink hat]] with a musical note, a [[white capelet]], a [[pink dress]] with a musical note on the front, white gloves, and [[red footwear|red]] [[shoes]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(dark_night)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 7 when she captures the [[Silent (clow card)|]] Card.

She wears a [[green hat]], a [[green shirt]] with blue argyle patterns and black [[bat wings]], [[black gloves]], [[green shorts]], and [[green thighhighs|green]] [[thigh boots]] with blue argyle patterns.

title: kinomoto_sakura_(green_sprite)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 30 when she captures the [[Dash (clow card)|]] Card.

She wears a [[green hat|green]] [[jester cap]], an [[orange vest]] over a [[green shirt]] and [[green shorts]], [[green gloves]], [[green thighhighs]], and [[orange footwear|orange]] [[shoes]].

title: kinomoto_sakura_(splendor)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 58 when she [spoiler]tries to change [[Yue (cardcaptor sakura)|]] and [[Kerberos]] back to their false forms.[/spoiler]

She wears a pair of blue [[pom pom (clothes)|pom poms]] with [[yellow ribbon]]s in her hair, a [[blue vest]] over a [[blue dress]], a [[black bodysuit]] beneath the dress, [[blue gloves]], and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[boots]].

title: watery_(clow_card)
body: A [[Clow Card]] from [[Cardcaptor Sakura]]. One of the original 19 cards from the manga, capable of controlling water. Sakura captures it in episode 3 of the anime after she locks it in a walk-in freezer. Sakura wears her [[kinomoto sakura (water fairy)|Blue Jester costume]] for this episode.

title: kinomoto_sakura_(princess_dreams)
body:
A costume that [[Kinomoto Sakura]] wears in the 90s anime, specifically in episode 24 when she captures the [[Little (clow card)|]] Card.

It is a [[blue dress]] with a [[white apron]], a [[pink bow]] in her hair, a [[white bow]] at the back, [[white thighhighs]], and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[mary janes]]. In the manga, her hair bow is colored [[blue bow|blue]] instead.

title: kinomoto_sakura_(magician)
body:
One of [[Kinomoto Sakura]]'s costumes that [[Daidouji Tomoyo]] made for her, and easily the most recognizable and popular one. Sakura wears it in the anime's first opening song [i]Catch You Catch Me[/i], though she's never actually depicted capturing Clow Cards while wearing it despite how well-known it is. Due to this costume's popularity, it can also be attributed to [[parody|parodies]] where other characters are wearing an adapted variant of it.

It is a [[pink dress]] over a [[white shirt|white blouse]] with [[puffy sleeves]] and a [[red bow]], a [[pink hat|pink]] [[mob cap]] with a [[pink bow]], [[white wings]], [[white gloves]] with a red bow, [[white thighhighs]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[mary janes]].

title: bernadetta_von_varley
body:
Character from [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]]. A member of the Black Eagles.

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[purple hair]], [[grey eyes]], and [[small breasts]]. She has two different designs, one as a teenager and one as an adult. The teenager design features her own version of the [[Garreg Mach Monastery Uniform]] in her case being a [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] [[black coat]] with [[gold trim]] and a [[black skirt]], additionally her version includes a [[hoodie]], [[black shorts|black]] [[bike shorts]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots]]. The adult design features a [[strapless dress|strapless]] [[purple dress|purple]] [[short dress]] with [[long sleeves]] which may potentially show [[cleavage]] and her upper back, [[yellow gloves|yellow]]/[[purple gloves]], [[purple shorts|purple]] [[bike shorts]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]].

She has anxiety issues [spoiler]due to her abusive father[/spoiler] and often hides in her room to avoid interacting with other people. In-game, she excels as an archer with high speed and dexterity, but weak durability.

Voiced by [[Erica Mendez]] (English), [[Tsuji Ayumi]] (Japanese).

title: lorenz_hellman_gloucester
body:
Character in [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]] and member of the Golden Deer.

A noble who often takes his duties seriously and is very prideful about his status. Although, he can be unintentionally be seen as classist and pretentious to those around him, especially commonfolk. However, he has an affinity for tea and writing poetry.

[spoiler]After the five-year timeskip, he has grown out of his classist views, believing the value of a person should be based on the quality of their soul, regardless of their upbringing.[/spoiler]

Voiced by: "Benjamin Diskin":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benjamin_Diskin] (English), "Watanabe Hiroshi":[https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/encyclopedia/people.php?id=134753] (Japanese).

Not to be confused with [[Lorenz (fire emblem)|]], a character from [[Fire Emblem: Shadow Dragon and the Blade of Light]] and [[Fire Emblem: Mystery of the Emblem]].

title: leonie_pinelli
body:
Character from [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]] and a member of the Golden Deer.

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[orange hair]], [[orange eyes]], and [[medium breasts]] ([[large breasts|large]] after the in-game timeskip).

A commoner from the Leicester Alliance, she looks up to [[Jeralt Reus Eisner|Captain Jeralt]] and wants to become a mercenary like him.

In-game, Leonie has high speed and dexterity, as well as reasonable strength and physical durability, but she's very weak to magic and doesn't use magic well herself. She's considered one of the best characters in the game statistically because of her good stat growths and lack of skill weaknesses.

title: claude_von_riegan
body:
Main character in [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]].

He is the leader of the Golden Deer house and heir to House Riegan.

Claude is a cunning and unpredictable strategist with an easygoing attitude. Despite this, he is a lot more knowledgeable than he lets on. His schemes generally involve mind games and dirty tactics to throw his foes off. He likes feasts, long rides, archery and topics of curiosity.

[spoiler]He is also the crown prince to Almyra and was discriminated due to his mixed heritage. His dream is to break cultural barriers between Fódlan and Almyra and open Fódlan to the outside world. His real name is Khalid.[/spoiler]

Voiced by: [[Joe Zieja]] (English), [[Toyonaga Toshiyuki]] (Japanese)

body:
Character in [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]] and a member of the Golden Deer, serving as the de facto "retainer" of [[Claude von Riegan]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[pink hair]], [[pink eyes]], and [[large breasts]].

A girl who has been spoiled by her father and her brother [[Holst Sigiswald Goneril|Holst]], Hilda has a lazy personality and often uses excuses to exempt herself from any work she does not want to do, or uses her physical beauty to charm others into doing tasks for her. Despite being lazy, Hilda is a fashionable and friendly girl who can be genuinely helpful if she puts effort into something.

Not to be confused with [[Hilda (Fire Emblem)|]], a character from [[Fire Emblem: Genealogy of The Holy War]].

Voiced by: "Salli Saffioti":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salli_Saffioti] / Celeste Henderson (English), [[Kuwahara Yuuki]] (Japanese).

title: byakuya_(under_night_in-birth)
body:
Character who appears in [[Under Night In-Birth]]. He is an enigma, following along with his sister, [[Tsukuyomi (Under Night In-Birth)|Tsukuyomi]], as they wander through the Hollow Night. He has no other motive other than to follow his sister's orders, usually involving him sinking the [[claws]] of his EXS, [i]Chelicerata[/i], into unwary victims. [spoiler]It is revealed that he knew Tsukuyomi was in fact, not his real sister. However, he is still willing to help her find what she's searching for.[/spoiler] Fans often liken his appearance to [[Narukami Yu]] of [i][[Persona]][/i] fame.

title: please_stop_beatboxing_(meme)
body:
*Starts Beatboxing* refers to a parody meme format in which images of people and characters covering their mouths while crying or in surprise are intentionally misinterpreted as if they are beatboxing due to the similarity of the gesture. In 2020, a WikiHow image depicting a man crying near his dying partner gained popularity as the Please Stop Beatboxing redraw format.

"Knowyourmeme":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/starts-beatboxing-please-stop-beatboxing]

title: common_kingfisher
body:
Latin: [i]Alcedo atthis[/i]
JP: カワセミ [i]kawasemi[/i]

This sparrow-sized kingfisher has blue upperparts and orange underparts, with an orange band from beak to behind the eye that turns into a short white neck-level stripe. Like all kingfishers it has a stubby tail and a long bill contoured for catching fish.

It is a year-round resident in Japan and can be found through much of Europe and Asia.

title: daredevil
body:
[[Marvel]] superhero who [[superhero costume|wears]] a [[red bodysuit]] with a devil-themed hood. He is blind, but in turn the rest of his senses are heightened, allowing him to observe his surroundings and fight without vision. He primarily fights street-level crime in the Hell's Kitchen district of Manhattan, New York and his civilian identity is the lawyer [[Matt Murdock]].

Recently, [[Elektra Natchios]] has taken up the Daredevil mantle as well. When active as Daredevil, Elektra uses modified blunt [[sai (weapon)|]] with extendable [[cable]]s that allow her to non-lethally subdue enemies.

title: sega_cd
body:
The [b]Sega CD[/b], released as the [b]Mega-CD[/b] (メガCD [i]Mega-Shī Dī[/i]) in most regions outside North America, is an add-on device for the [[Sega Mega Drive]] [[video game]] [[game_console|console]], designed and produced by [[Sega]]. 

As part of the fourth generation of video game consoles, the Sega CD was released in Japan in [[1991]], North America in [[1992]] and in Europe and other regions in [[1993]]. The device adds a CD-ROM drive to the Mega Drive console, allowing the user to play CD-based games and providing additional hardware functionality. Other benefits of the add-on include a faster central processing unit and graphic enhancements. It can also play audio CDs and CD+G discs. The main benefit of the new add-on's technology was its larger disc space, allowing for larger games to be developed. This would manifest itself in the form of full motion video (FMV) games.

By the end of [[1994]], the add-on had sold approximately 2.7 million units worldwide. In [[1995]], it was announced that Sega's support would shift away from the Mega Drive and Sega CD to focus on its new console, the [[Sega Saturn]], and the add-on itself was officially discontinued in [[1996]]. 

Retrospective reception to the add-on is mixed, praising the Sega CD for its individual offerings and additions to the Mega Drive's functions, but criticizing the game library as a whole for its lack of depth and low value for money, as well as issues with how the add-on was supported by Sega.

title: n_(pokemon)
body:
Lead antagonist of [[pokemon_bw|Pokemon Black and White]], and supporting character in [[pokemon_bw2|Pokemon Black 2 and White 2]].

He is the "King" of [[Team Plasma]]. He regularly challenges the player character, [[Hilbert (pokemon)|]] or [[Hilda (pokemon)|]], in order to confirm his ideas of justice. He calls Pokémon "friends", but he wants to split humans and Pokémon and divide them to create a black and white world, as he wanted to set Pokémon free from people (who he viewed to be their oppressor), and looks for the power to bring his idea to reality. 

He returns in the sequel games to help thwart the schemes of his father, [[Ghetsis (pokemon)|]], who has formed his own Team Plasma with the intent of taking over Unova by force.

Full Name: [b]Natural Harmonia Gropius[/b]

title: goldenglow_(arknights)
body:
[i]Hairdresser and new Caster Goldenglow, tormented by the cycle of shocking and getting shocked.[/i]

A playable Caster Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Susie Glitter

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Victoria[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]January 7[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Feline[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]159 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]None[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

An aspiring Victorian hairdresser with electric-based Originium Arts, the sixth child of the large Glitter family.
After the events in Caladon City, she joined Rhodes Island under the recommendation of [[quercus_(arknights)|Quercus]], [[grani_(arknights)|Grani]], and Bitter Root.
She currently works as a beautician at Rhodes Island hair salon. 

At the end of the 1st Anniversary livestream for the CN version of Arknights in mid-2020, a post-credit sequence teased then-upcoming operators [[Thorns (Arknights)|]], [[Surtr (Arknights)|]], [[Saga (Arknights)|]], [[Archetto (Arknights)|]], [[Mountain (Arknights)|]], and Goldenglow. Despite appearing alongside them, by the time of the 2nd anniversary a full year later, she alone remained unreleased, her name still unknown. Speculation ran rampant on why she hadn't appeared yet, even leading to her being misidentified as a Perro rather than a Feline. It wouldn't be until February 8th, 2022 that she would be finally announced properly, class and named included, to appear at the mini event [i]A Light Spark in Darkness[/i].

Despite her ears, her motif is based on [[cat|Cats]], specifically the [[Scottish Fold]].

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Sakura Ayane]].

h4. Skins

* !post #5670385: Default
* !post #7018212: [[goldenglow (maiden for the bright night) (arknights)|Maiden for the Bright Night]]
* !post #7152576: [[goldenglow (summer flowers) (arknights)|Summer Flowers]]
* !post #7727639: [[goldenglow (party in the garden) (arknights)|Party in the Garden]]

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[bangs]] & a [[side braid]]. As a [[magical girl]] she wears a [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]], [[red bow]], [[wide sleeves|wide]] [[frilled sleeves]], [[frilled collar]], [[black thighhighs]], [[fur-trimmed coat|fur-trimmed]] [[black coat]], [[frilled skirt]], [[corset]], and [[black footwear]]. She is usually [[holding umbrella|holding]] an [[umbrella]].

She is voiced by [[Kugimiya Rie]].

title: batman_vs._teenage_mutant_ninja_turtles
body: Batman vs. Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles is an American animated superhero film directed by Jake Castorena and written by Marly Halpern-Graser. Inspired by the [[DC Comics]] and IDW Publishing comic book miniseries [[Batman]]/[[Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles]] by James Tynion IV and Freddie Williams II, the story focuses on Batman, Robin, and Batgirl teaming up with the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles in order to save Gotham City from chaos at the hands of both Shredder and [[Ra's al Ghul]]. Produced by Warner Bros. Animation in association with DC Entertainment and [[Nickelodeon]].

title: joker_(dc)
body:
[[Batman|Batman's]] archnemesis and the main antagonist of [[DC comics]]' [i][[batman (series)|Batman]][/i] series and movies. A maniacal clown with green hair, bleached skin and a grotesque grin, Joker is a brilliant criminal mastermind and expert chemist who specializes in weaponized props and toxins. He is also a murderous psychopath with a horrific sense of humor and a pathological obsession with Batman.

The Joker is created by the late Bob Kane, the late Bill Finger, and the late Jerry Robinson and first appeared in [i]Batman[/i] #1 (April 25, 1940).

One of the most recognized characters in popular culture, the Joker has been listed among the greatest comic book villains and fictional characters ever created. His likeness has appeared on merchandise such as clothing and collectible items, and he has inspired real-world structures (such as theme park attractions) and been referenced in various media. The Joker has been adapted in live-action, animated, and video game incarnations.

h4. Notable Incarnations
* The Joker ([[Batman: the Animated Series]]) - The Joker as portrayed in the DC Animated Universe
* [[Arthur Fleck]] - Civilian identity in the [i][[joker (2019)|JOKER]][/i] continuity
* [[Jerome Valeska]] and [[Jeremiah Valeska]] - Civilian identities in the [i][[Gotham (series)]][/i] continuity
other_names: ジョーカー(バットマン)

title: sasha_calle
body: Sasha Calle (born August 7, 1995) is an American actress. She starred in the soap opera The Young and the Restless from 2018 to 2021, for which she received a nomination for a Daytime Emmy Award. She made her film debut as [[Supergirl]] in the superhero film [[The Flash (movie)|The Flash]] (2023).

title: fantastic_four_(2015_film)
body:
[b]Fantastic Four[/b] (stylized as [b]FANT4STIC[/b]) is a 2015 superhero film based on the [[Marvel|Marvel Comics]] [[Fantastic Four|team of the same name]]. Directed by Josh Trank, who co-wrote the screenplay with Jeremy Slater and Simon Kinberg, it stars Miles Teller, Michael B. Jordan, Kate Mara, Jamie Bell and Toby Kebbell. The film follows a group of intelligent teenagers who build a transdimensional portal, causing them to gain superhuman abilities.

Fantastic Four premiered at Williamsburg Cinemas in New York City on August 4, 2015, and was released on August 7 in the United States. The film received negative reviews from critics and was considered a box-office bomb, grossing $167.9 million worldwide against a production budget of $120 million, with an estimated loss between $80–$100 million for the studio. Fantastic Four received several Golden Raspberry Awards, including Worst Director and Worst Picture. Trank also voiced his displeasure with the final film, which he attributed to production studio [[20th Century Studios|20th Century Fox]]'s interference.

title: holox
body:
The 6th batch of [[virtual youtuber|VTubers]] from [[hololive]], dubbed  as "holoX" (pronounced "holoks"). Their theme is a secret organization. To fit with the "secrecy" theme, Cover co. announced the group's existence only 9 hours before the first member, [[La+ Darknesss]], debuted on 26 November 2021.

Also worth noting is that unlike [[hololive Fantasy]] (3rd gen) and [[holoForce]] (4th gen), holoX marks the first time since [[hololive Gamers]] that a hololive JP talent group starts out with a name of their own, a tradition normally associated only with [[hololive English]].

[u]Use this tag when:[/u]

title: m1_bazooka
body:
This name originally referred to the American World War II rocket launcher known as the M1, which got the name Bazooka because it reminded American infantry of the tubular musical instrument invented and popularized by U.S. radio comedian Bob Burns in the 1930s. It is now used as a generic term for any manner of tube-like shoulder-fired rocket launcher, but that's not what the Danbooru tag is for.

Developed by the [[United States Army]] and approved for service in 1940, the M1 Bazooka was the first of its kind: using a rocket (rather than an anti-tank rifle or a handheld grenade) to shoot a shaped charge at enemy tanks. The Bazooka saw extensive use on all fronts of the war, used against enemy bunkers, pillboxes, fortified positions, and even tanks. 

After the disastrous Battle of Kasserine Pass in early 1943, many examples of the Bazooka fell into German hands. Impressed with the innovative idea, the Germans copied the Bazooka wholesale, enlarging the rocket and adding a shield to the tube to protect the shooter from backblast, calling the new weapon the [[panzerschreck]], or "tank terror".

title: ishuzoku_reviewers
body:
[b]Ishuzoku Reviewers[/b] (異種族レビュアーズ, lit. "Interspecies Reviewers") is a manga series written by [[amahara (amahara teikoku)|Amahara]] and illustrated by [[masha]], first published in 2014, about reviewing brothels run by and filled with various girls of varied race. Undead, elves, demons, faeries all judged in their ability to satisfy by an assembly of three fantasy races and a human.

An anime adaptation debuted on January 2020, which became controversial due to its explicit sexual content, most notably [[prostitution]]. The anime was banned by mainstream networks in Japan and pulled from Funimation's website after being aired for only 3 episodes. In response, the website [i]MyAnimeList[/i] was flooded with positive reviews, which temporarily turned the show into the highest rated anime of all time on the site.

body:
A [b]man-portable[/b] [[weapon]] that fires a rocket-propelled projectile at a target. This tag is a catch-all term for any types of them, including [[multishot rocket launcher]]s, man-portable air-defense systems (MANPADs), anti-tank systems, and more. Because missiles they fire are considered as guided rockets.

For tagging purpose and despite the technical distinctions, [b]recoilless rifle[/b] is aliased into rocket launcher due to identical external appearance of the specific models and the same purpose of both weapon classes.

See [[missile pod]] for [[military vehicle|vehicle]] mounted rocket and [[missile]] systems.

h4. List of rocket launchers

title: male_swimwear_challenge
body:
Art challenge where a female character is made to wear [[male swimwear]], either [[jammers]] or [[swim trunks]], while also [[topless female|topless]] and in a public space such as a [[beach]] or [[pool]]. [[reverse trap|Works best]] with an [[androgynous]]-looking [[short hair|short-haired]] female character with a [[tomboy|boyish]] haircut and a [[flat chest]] or [[small breasts]], but art featuring obviously female characters with longer hair and/or larger busts can also suffice, possibly for definite titillation of the viewer and [[embarrassed|embarrassment]] for the subject. [[Tomboy]]s are frequently used as subjects to emphasize their masculine personalities.

While art of girls in male swimwear have been around for quite some time, the first direct response to the challenge appears to have been from November 21, 2020 on Twitter and Pixiv with post #4212758 (originally uploaded to Pixiv on the said date).

This tag can only be applied for direct art responses uploaded on Twitter or any art site on or after November 21, 2020. While the "男水着チャレンジ" tag is also being retroactively added to art uploaded prior to the said date on Pixiv, Nico Nico, and the like which appear to follow the concept, it is discouraged to do so here since it is highly likely the retroactive tag additions in said art sites are just mere afterthoughts.

h4. See also

* [[crossdressing]]
* [[exhibitionism]]

title: monokini
body:
In modern terminology, a [b]monokini[/b] is a type of [[one-piece swimsuit|one-piece]] [[swimsuit]] where the swimsuit is only connected in the front by the conjoining swimsuit. In detail, there are large [[clothing cutout|cutout]]s around the sides and generally [[backless outfit|less coverage from the back]]. It's a more aesthetic look to the one-piece swimsuit being a combination to that of a [[bikini]] and one-piece.

The earliest term of monokini originates in the mid-1960s, designed by Rudi Gernreich, where it was first introduced as a [[topless female|topless]] swimsuit with two shoulder straps. This term has since became obsolete in the later years, but some modern topless monokini still exist alongside the one-piece monokinis.

title: interface_headset_(evangelion)
body:
A device worn on the heads of [[neon_genesis_evangelion|Evangelion]] pilots in addition to their [[plugsuit (evangelion)|plugsuits]].

A standard interface headset consists of a low-profile headband with a pod at either end. The headset goes around the back of the wearer's head from underneath the hair, with only the two pods appearing in plain sight.

It is likely due to a misunderstanding of this construction that they are sometimes (mistakenly) referred to as "A10 nerve clips", being confused for [[hairclip]]s. There are no canonical materials suggesting that the device has anything directly to do with A10 nerve synchronization, and only [[Souryuu Asuka Langley]] wears an interface headset in the form of an actual pair of separate hairclips.

h4. External links

* "Interface Headset - EvaWiki":[https://wiki.evageeks.org/Interface_Headset]

title: planet
body:
A large spherical astronomical object that typically [[in orbit| orbit]]s a [[star (sky)|]]. The tag should be used when at least one planet is seen from outer [[space]] or from the surface of another nearby planet. This includes real and fictional planets.  

Scientifically, there has always been some ambiguity as to what constitutes a planet, with some celestial bodies such as [[Pluto (planet)|]] and Ceres being considered at different times or by different people either as planets or as "dwarf planets". The International Astronomical Union (IAU) came up with a definition for a planet in 2006, meaning that the planets in our solar system are officially [[Mercury_(planet)|]], [[Venus (planet)|]], [[Earth (planet)|]], [[Mars_(planet)|]], [[Jupiter (planet)|]], [[Saturn (planet)|]], [[Uranus (planet)|]] and [[neptune (planet)|]], but the definition remains contentious.

title: project_kv
body:
An abandoned multimedia project that was to be developed by DynamisOne and Studio Alaya. The project had been given the nickname "[[Blue Archive]] with Swords" or "Red Archive" due to not only sharing a similar theme of school girls with [[halo]]s and weapons, but is made by several former Blue Archive developers.

It was initially teased on August 18th, 2024, before a promo video officially revealed it on September 1st, with a visual novel planned for [[Comiket 105]], and a gacha game speculated to release in the future. The project has been "cancelled":[https://x.com/DynamisOne/status/1832722210160554111] on September 8th, 2024, speculated to be due to both controversy surrounding accusations of plagiarism, and a suspected threat of a copyright infringement lawsuit from [[Nexon]], Blue Archive's publisher.

Peculiarly, since the project's announcement, it has spawned a trend of [[futanari]] fanarts. This trend stemmed from the Korean community, where it was joked that the project would be more popular if it involved "cockfighting" rather than "sword fighting". The original jokes originated from joking KV stood for the Korean slang words "kochu" (sword) and "valgi" (sword drawing), which is used for [[penis]] and [[erection]], respectively.

On February 27th, 2025, it was revealed that the project was originally developed by Nexon, titled "MX Blade," serving as a side story to Blue Archive in production years before Blue Archive was released. With the aftermath of the incident induced by Dynamis One, this original project has since been shelved. Dynamis One would respond on March 18th, however by that point the relevant team members were already in captivity before the announcement post was even shared with the public. 

h4. External links

* "Official Site (Shut Down)":[https://www.projectkv.co.kr]
* "Official Twitter":[https://twitter.com/DynamisOne]

title: multicolored_sweater

title: shoushimin_series
body:
A mystery novel series by Yonezawa Honobu (米澤穂信) that was first published in December 2004 by Sougen Suiri Bunko (litetally called [i]Petit Bourgeoisie[/i]). There is a Summer 2024 anime adaptation by [i]Lapin Track[/i]. 

[[Kobato Jougorou]] is a boy who wanted to reduce his habit of deducting and over-analyzing everything, [[Osanai Yuki]] is a girl who is avoided by others because of her strange tendencies. Both of them desire nothing more than to have a simple and peaceful high school life. This is a story about two people who are aiming and working together to be [i]inconspicuous citizens[/i] (petit bourgeois).

h4. Characters

* [[Kobato Jougorou]]
* [[Osanai Yuki]]

title: nekomata_okayu_(oversized_shirt)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Nekomata Okayu]].

Known as her "oversized shirt" (or "boyfriend's shirt" in Japanese) costume from [i]hololive Closet[/i], it consists of an [[open jacket|open]] [[black jacket]] worn over a [[partially unbuttoned]] [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[dress shirt]] and a [[purple ribbon|purple]] [[neck ribbon]] and [[no pants]]. Her shirt has a couple of [[button gap]]s, which reveal that she's apparently [[no bra|not wearing a bra]]. She also wears a [[slippers]] with a [[dog print]] on it; matching with [[Inugami Korone|Korone]]'s cat print slippers.

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has [[medium hair|medium]] [[messy hair]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[colored inner hair|on the inside]] and [[diagonal bangs]] (although many artist often omit this detail and draw her with [[blunt bangs]] or just messy bangs instead).

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25246273: Profile
* !post #4768996: Merchandise (without glasses)
* !post #4820795: Merchandise (with glasses)

h4. See also

* [[Ogyayu (nekomata okayu)|]] - an unofficial variant of this outfit depicting Okayu as a [[gyaru]]
